title.narrative: OCCRP regional Eastern Europe and Western Balkans 2018 - 2022
OCCRP regionalt Östeuropa och Västra Balkan 2018 - 2022

description.narrative:
Organisationen Journalism Development Network (JDN) har genom sitt varunamn “the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP)” ansökt om finansiering från Sida om 27 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet "Maximizing Investigative Journalism and Independent Media to Advance Accountability and Development" i Östra Partnerskapsländerna och Västra Balkan (Ukraina, Moldavien, Armenien, Georgien, Azerbajdzjan, Vitryssland och Bosnien Hercegovina, Kosovo, Makedonien, Montenegro, Albanien and Serbien) samt Turkiet under perioden 2018-2022.
Insatsen ämnar stärka grävande journalistik och oberoende medias roll att agera som en tillförlitlig källa, att eftersträva transparens och ansvarsutkrävande, motverka organiserad brottslighet och korruption samt skydda rättssäkerheten och mänskliga rättigheter genom att 1) Stärka och expandera grävande journalistik genom undersökande research och publicering, 2) Öka antalet läsare och mottagare av grävande journalistik, och 3) Stärka organisationens infrastruktur, kapacitet och säkerhet för att möjliggöra att organisationen kan nå dess egna vision. Insatsen avser ett administrativt projektstöd och implementeras av OCCRP i samarbete med dess medlemsorganisationer i ovan nämnda länder.
Projektets totala budget är 27 miljoner SEK. OCCRP:s totala inkomst för 2018 beräknas uppgå till 5 miljoner USD, varav projektets budget utgör 16 procent.

The organisation Journalism Development Network (JDN) has through its trade name “The Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP)” applied to Sida for funding of 27 million SEK to carry out the "Maximizing Investigative Journalism and Independent Media to Advance Accountability and Development" in the countries of the Eastern Partnership and Western Balkans (Ukraine, Moldova, Armenia, Georgia, Belarus, Azerbaijan and Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Macedonia, Montenegro, Albania and Serbia) as well as Turkey during the period 2018-2022.
The intervention aims at maximizing investigative journalism and the role of independent media as a trusted source of actionable information, to press for transparency and accountability, combat organized crime and corruption, and protect the rule of law and fundamental human rights by: 1) Strengthen and accelerate investigative reporting through investigative research and publication; 2) Grow the audience and consumers of investigative reporting and 3) Grow the infrastructure, capacity, and security of the organization to achieve the vision. The project support will support OCCRP’s core costs and be implemented by OCCRP in collaboration with its members in the aforementioned countries.
The project’s total budget is 27 million SEK. However, the estimated revenue of OCCRP for 2018 is 5 million USD, of which the project's budget constitutes 16 percent.

The intervention's objective is presented as: "Maximizing investigative journalism and the role of independent media as a trusted source of actionable information, to press for transparency and accountability, combat organized crime and corruption, and protect the rule of law and fundamental human rights."

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.4 - By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial and arms flows, strengthen the recovery and return of stolen assets and combat all forms of organized crime.
16.4 - Till 2030 avsevärt minska de olagliga finansiella flödena och vapenflödena, öka möjligheterna att återvinna och återfå stulna tillgångar samt bekämpa alla former av organiserad brottslighet.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: OCCRP reports for the year 2020-2021 that their investigations have continued to attract international, regional and local media attention and had demonstrable impact: international organizations as well state authorities in several countries took legal or regulatory action after the publication of OCCRP investigations. Local impact as a result of local or regional investigations was seen, among other countries, in Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Belarus, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Turkey, Moldova and Ukraine. OCCRP partners also continue to receive international, regional and local awards and prizes, including the IJ4EU Impact Award an excellence in cross-border investigative reporting award for its Troika Laundromat and Fraud Factory projects and the Serbian Member Center received a 2021 Sigma Award (OCCRP won this award for the third year in a row) for its Judge who Judges Database project. The biggest projects involving the target countries that OCCRP worked on with a number of other partners were The Pegasus Project, The Pandora Papers and OpenLux Project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
